intro: Feuilleea stenocalyx, commonly known as the narrow calyx leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Feuilleea stenocalyx thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
